aboutCards.heading: What is AEMMA
aboutCards.p1: The Academy of European Medi√¶val Martial Arts (AEMMA) is a Historical European Medieval Martial Arts School with locations across Canada. We have been teaching medieval swordfighting for 25 years.

aboutCards.heading: What classes does AEMMA Ottawa offer?
aboutCards.p1: The Ottawa chapter is training, studying and preserving the martial heritage and rich traditions of medieval and Renaissance Italy, with a focus on the Bolognese and Florentine traditions of the 16th century.

aboutCards.heading: What historical sources does AEMMA use?
aboutCards.p1: At AEMMA Ottawa, all our classes are based on the teaching of historical fencing masters, with a particular emphasis on Fiore dei Liberi, Giovanni Dall‚ÄôAgocchie, Achille Marozzo, Antonio Manciolino, the Anonimo Bolognese and the Anonimo Riccardiano.

aboutCards.heading: Where is AEMMA Ottawa located?
aboutCards.p1: AEMMA Ottawa is located at 1606 Fisher Avenue, in the main hall of St. Mark‚Äôs Anglican Church, just west of Mooney‚Äôs Bay and Carleton University.

aboutCards.heading: How can I join AEMMA Ottawa?
aboutCards.p1: Take a look at our Classes page for more information on our curriculum, schedule, pricing, and how to get started. Classes are 16 years old and up.

aboutCards.heading: Which weapons do we study?
aboutCards.p1: Our primary focus is the sword in one hand, along with its secondaries (dagger, cloak, buckler), sword in two hands, polearms, pugnale (dagger), and wrestling.

cards.title: Training
cards.text: We study and apply historical techniques from authentic manuscripts.

cards.title: Rich history
cards.text: Our methods are rooted in the martial traditions of the 15th and 16th centuries.

cards.title: Supportive, inclusive community
cards.text: We welcome martial artists of all levels and backgrounds.
